page.title: 01KETTERING-LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Kettering was first named Cytringan.In the Domesday Book of 1086 it is recorded as Cateringe.The village became a town in 1227 when Kettering was granted the right to have a market. In 1792 a group led by Andrew Fuller launched the Baptist Missionary Society from the town.William Knibb was born in the town in 1803.He was a Baptist Missionary and became famous for his work to abolish slavery.With the opening of the Railway in 1857 Kettering's Boot & Shoe Trade began to develop although this has declined in recent years.Kettering's town centre has undergone a transformation, Victorian buildings have been demolished to make way for the Newborough Centre.Phases 1&2 have been completed.Kettering is also the home of Wicksteed Park,a popular leisure park.
